qas.question: What type of flight decks are aircraft carriers equipped with?
What purpose do aircraft carriers serve for aircraft?
Typically, what is the capital ship of any fleet?
What do aircraft carriers allow naval forces to accomplish?

answers.text: project air power worldwide without depending on local bases

qas.question: What have the old converted cruiser aircraft carriers evolved into?

plausible_answers.text: project air power worldwide without depending on local bases

context: <a2_0><b7_0>An aircraft carrier<b7_0/><a2_0/> is a warship that serves as a seagoing airbase, equipped with a <a0_0><b5_0>full-length<b5_0/><a0_0/> flight deck and facilities for <a1_0><b6_0>carrying, arming, deploying, and recovering<a1_0/> aircraft<b6_0/>. Typically, it is the capital ship of a fleet, as it allows a naval force to <a3_0><b8_0>project air power worldwide without depending on local bases<b8_0/><a3_0/> for staging aircraft operations. Aircraft carriers are expensive to build and are critical assets. Aircraft carriers have evolved from converted cruisers to <a4_0><b9_0>nuclear-powered warships<b9_0/><a4_0/> that carry numerous fighter planes, strike aircraft, helicopters, and other types of aircraft.
